Key Match Events: Burundi’s opening goal came from Chimwemwe Idana’s own goal in the 22nd minute.
Chawanangwa Kaonga equalized for Malawi in the 31st minute.
Jean Claude Girumugisha scored for Burundi two minutes after Malawi's equalizer.
Lanjesi Nkhoma scored for Malawi in the second half with an assist from Kaonga.
Mokono Elie Eldhino scored the winning goal for Burundi in the 87th minute.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Burundi is currently at the top of Group L as Senegal prepares to host Burkina Faso.
Malawi will travel to Bamako, Mali for their second Group L match against Burkina Faso next week.
Malawi will face Senegal back-to-back in October.
Burundi will host Senegal at BNS.
